item.title: Golden Gate and Let's Encrypt
item.description: I am currently serving all the things out of my home from behind my “Golden Gate proxy,” which is a combination of an nginx reverse proxy, an SSH WebSocket proxy, and an SSH bastion host. My Golden Gate services are on their own dedicated VM, separate from the VMs running my actual services. I use the Certbot (previously Let’s Encrypt), “webroot” plugin which places some verification files at $DOMAIN/.well-known.
